metadata.title: Higgs Sector Derivation Chain
metadata.description: Complete step-by-step derivation of Higgs sector from G₂ geometry
metadata.author: Andrew Keith Watts

modulus_constraint.note: Inverted from Higgs mass; NOT a geometric prediction

derivation_chain.title: Electroweak VEV from W Boson Mass
derivation_chain.description: Derive Higgs vacuum expectation value from measured W boson mass and electroweak coupling constant

references.citation: Higgs, P.W. (1964). Broken Symmetries and Gauge Bosons. Phys. Rev. Lett. 13, 508
Particle Data Group (2024). Review of Particle Physics

derivation_chain.notes: Standard Model result. The value v = 246 GeV is conventionally chosen to match experimental data.

derivation_chain.title: Higgs Quartic Coupling from Mass
derivation_chain.description: Extract Higgs self-coupling from the measured Higgs mass using tree-level relation

lambda_MZ.description: Higgs quartic coupling at M_Z scale

references.citation: Weinberg, S. (1967). A Model of Leptons. Phys. Rev. Lett. 19, 1264

derivation_chain.notes: Tree-level relation. Running effects from RG evolution are included in Step 7.

derivation_chain.title: Higgs Potential Minimization

equation.plain_text: V(H) = -μ²|H|² + λ|H|⁴; minimize to get v² = μ²/λ
equation.wolfram: Solve[{v^2 == mu^2 / lambda, m^2 == 2*mu^2, lambda == 0.12963}, {mu, v, m}]

derivation_chain.description: Minimize the Higgs scalar potential to derive EWSB condition and relate mass parameter μ to observable quantities

references.citation: Englert, F. & Brout, R. (1964). Broken Symmetry and Gauge Masses. Phys. Rev. Lett. 13, 321

derivation_chain.notes: The negative μ² triggers spontaneous symmetry breaking, giving masses to W and Z bosons.

derivation_chain.title: Moduli Stabilization from Higgs Mass

equation.plain_text: Re(T) = (λ₀ - λ_eff) / (κ y_t²); λ_eff = m_H² / (8π² v²)

derivation_chain.description: Invert the Higgs mass formula from racetrack superpotential to constrain the volume modulus Re(T). CRITICAL: This shows m_H is INPUT, not prediction!

theory.interpretation: Higgs mass CONSTRAINS modulus; it is NOT derived from geometry

v_yukawa.note: NOT the same as v_EW = 246 GeV

lambda_0.status: FITTED to match m_H when Re(T) = 1.833

critical_note.circular_dependency: The phenomenological value Re(T) = 9.865 is DERIVED from m_H = 125.10 GeV by inverting this formula. It is NOT a geometric prediction!
critical_note.resolution: Use m_H as INPUT to constrain Re(T) = 9.865

references.citation: KKLT (2003). de Sitter Vacua in String Theory. JHEP 0306:021
Watts, A.K. (2025). Higgs Mass Constraint on G₂ Moduli. Principia Metaphysica v14.1

derivation_chain.notes: This step reveals a CIRCULAR CONSTRAINT in the theory. The Higgs mass is INPUT, not output.

derivation_chain.title: Doublet-Triplet Splitting via TCS Topology
derivation_chain.description: Topological suppression from TCS discrete torsion separates Higgs doublets (light) from triplets (heavy), protecting proton stability

theory.mechanism: TCS discrete torsion on b2=4 cycles
theory.doublets: Zero-modes localized at fixed points → M_D ~ M_EW
theory.triplets: Massive from Pneuma coupling to shadow sector → M_T ~ M_GUT

splitting_ratio.interpretation: Factor of ~10^13 protects proton from decay

physics_interpretation.proton_protection: Triplets mediate proton decay (p → e⁺ π⁰). Splitting factor ~10^13 suppresses decay rate to τ_p ~ 10^34 years.
physics_interpretation.gauge_hierarchy: Explains why Higgs doublet remains light while triplet is heavy
physics_interpretation.geometric_origin: TCS topology provides natural mechanism (no fine-tuning)

references.citation: Joyce, D. (2000). Compact Manifolds with Special Holonomy. Oxford Math. Monographs
Watts, A.K. (2025). Doublet-Triplet Splitting via TCS. Principia Metaphysica v14.1

derivation_chain.notes: This is a GEOMETRIC PREDICTION, not a tuned parameter. The splitting emerges from TCS topology.

derivation_chain.title: Yukawa Couplings from Higgs VEV
derivation_chain.description: Fermion masses arise from Yukawa couplings to the Higgs field via spontaneous symmetry breaking

theory.hierarchy: Yukawa couplings span 6 orders of magnitude (y_top ~ 1, y_electron ~ 10^-6)

y_top.note: Near unity, drives Higgs RG evolution

references.citation: Yukawa, H. (1935). On the Interaction of Elementary Particles. Proc. Phys. Math. Soc. Japan 17, 48
Particle Data Group (2024). Review of Particle Physics

derivation_chain.notes: Yukawa couplings are fundamental parameters in SM. In PM, they arise from Higgs field overlaps on G₂ cycles.

derivation_chain.title: Vacuum Stability to Planck Scale
derivation_chain.description: RG evolution of Higgs quartic coupling from M_Z to Planck scale. Stability requires λ(M_Pl) > 0 to prevent vacuum decay.

theory.problem: y_top ~ 1 drives λ negative around 10^10 GeV (SM metastability)
theory.pm_solution: Pneuma coupling adds positive contribution: β_λ += κ Re(T) y_t² / (16π²)

lambda_MPl_estimate.description: Estimated λ at Planck scale (simplified RG)

is_stable.description: Vacuum remains stable (λ > 0 at all scales)
is_stable.note: Simplified estimate; full 2-loop + threshold corrections needed

physics_interpretation.standard_model: SM alone has metastable vacuum (λ → negative around 10^10 GeV)
physics_interpretation.pm_resolution: Pneuma coupling adds positive contribution, stabilizing vacuum
physics_interpretation.prediction: No vacuum decay, universe is absolutely stable

references.citation: Degrassi et al. (2012). Higgs mass and vacuum stability. JHEP 1208:098
Watts, A.K. (2025). Vacuum Stability via Pneuma. Principia Metaphysica v14.1

derivation_chain.notes: This is a simplified 1-loop estimate. Full calculation requires 2-loop RG + threshold corrections at M_GUT.

internal_consistency.check: v_EW from Step 1 matches input to Step 2
Re(T) from Step 4 reproduces m_H when inverted
m_top from Step 6 matches PDG value

circular_constraint.issue: Higgs mass m_H = 125.10 GeV is used to CONSTRAIN Re(T) = 9.865, not derived from geometry
circular_constraint.resolution: Accept m_H as phenomenological INPUT; Re(T) is DERIVED from it
circular_constraint.implication: Higgs mass is not a prediction of Principia Metaphysica

geometric_predictions.vacuum_stability: Pneuma coupling stabilizes Higgs vacuum to M_Pl (PREDICTION)
